content:
is there a way to completely disable the invite system? i found this setting:
image.png

but there is no No. Invites are disabled setting..

reason i ask is, i still see the
image.png

link but some of my admins dont get things... (i know why are they admins in the first place.. legacy reasons..)

@Andreas that isn't currently supported, though I think we might be planning to build it. We split the settings in master like this:

image.png

And I think we just need to add a "nobody" option to that dropdown; @Sahil Batra is there a reason doing so would be hard?
ah, gotcha.. yeah, that would be good, thx @Tim Abbott

Tim Abbott said:

Andreas that isn't currently supported, though I think we might be planning to build it. We split the settings in master like this:

image.png

And I think we just need to add a "nobody" option to that dropdown; Sahil Batra is there a reason doing so would be hard?

I don't think so, would not require much changes.
Would admins be able to just change the setting to get invite permissions again?

They should be in normal case, but then there would be no real use of setting to Nobody.
Maybe we can add one more restriction that only owners can change the setting if it is set to Nobody to prevent admins from changing the settings.
in my use case my 'admins' wouldnt even know where to look, so that wouldnt actually be an issue.. however, having that said extra restriction in place would certainly be cool

Yeah, I think restricting changing that setting to owners is reasonable.

In any case, I think there's a benefit of not having an "Invite" option as communication to other administrators that one shouldn't use that feature in this organization.

@Tim Abbott do we want to restrict changing this setting to owners for all the values or just when the setting is set to Nobody. And if we want to do the second choice that if setting value is initially Nobody then only owners can change, then can admins set the setting value from any other value to Nobody or only owners can set it to Nobody.
@Sahil Batra I would just make the setting only editable by owners in all cases.
Do we only want Who can invite users setting to be editable by owners or the Invitations are required for joining setting also.
imho Invitations are required for joining as well, @Sahil Batra
@Sahil Batra yeah, I think simplest is to make the "how users join" section all owners-only configuration, in part from a "presenting how it works to users" perspective.
Ok, just to confirm we want the waiting period setting and the allowed domains also to be controlled by owners.
